sentences: Christina Stürmer (born 9 June 1982) is an Austrian singer and songwriter.
section: N/A

sentences: Born and raised in Linz, she rose to fame as the runner-up of the inaugural season of the ORF eins television talent series Starmania.
section: N/A

sentences: Following her participation, she signed with Universal Music and released her debut single "Ich lebe" which spent nine weeks atop the Austrian Singles Chart.
section: N/A

sentences: It was followed by the release of her first two albums, Freier Fall (2003) and Soll das wirklich alles sein (2004), both of which debuted atop the Austrian Albums Chart and produced eight top ten hits, including the number-one singles "Mama (Ana Ahabak)" and "Vorbei".
section: N/A

sentences: With the release of her international debut album Schwarz Weiss, Stürmer became one of the biggest-selling Austrian artists to emerge in German-speaking Europe in the mid-2000s.
section: N/A

sentences: She followed her international breakthrough with a series of successful albums, including the chart toppers Lebe lauter (2006), In dieser Stadt (2009), Ich hör auf mein Herz (2013) and Seite an Seite (2016).
section: N/A

sentences: Several singles from these album became hits on the pop charts in Austria, Germany, and Switzerland, including the number-one hits "Nie genug" and "Um bei dir zu sein" as well as top ten singles such as  "Mitten unterm Jahr" and Millionen Lichter".
section: N/A

sentences: Throughout a career spanning 15 years, Stürmer has sold over 2.0 million records.
section: N/A

sentences: Aside from her commercial accomplishments, her work has earned her numerous awards and accolades, including eleven Amadeus Austrian Music Awards, a Goldene Stimmgabel, and two ECHO Awards.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2015, Stürmer took part in the second season of the German The Best Singers adaptation Sing meinen Song – Das Tauschkonzert.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2017, she served as a coach on the German television series It Takes 2.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2003, Stürmer won second place in Starmania behind Michael Tschuggnall.

sentences: Shortly after that she released her first original song, "Ich Lebe" (I Live) which in 2003 occupied the number one spot on the Austrian music charts for nine weeks.

sentences: After "Ich Lebe" followed two more highly successful singles: "Geh nicht wenn du kommst" (Don't Go When You Come) and  the anti-war song Mama (Ana Ahabak) (Arabic for Mama, I Love You) which originated during the war in Iraq.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: The song represents a little Iraqi girl's perspective of the war, and it also spent nine weeks at the number one spot on the Austrian charts.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: Her first album, Freier Fall (Free Fall),  was released exclusively in Austria in May 2003, and it also rose quickly to the top of the charts, where it occupied the number one spot for weeks.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: In fall of 2003 she did an Austrian tour behind the strength of her first album.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: In May 2004 her second album, Soll das wirklich alles sein (Is that really everything?)
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: appeared, again only in Austria.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: The album was even more successful than Freier Fall, (Free Fall) but the album's singles had only average sales figures.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: The Wirklich alles!

sentences: (Really Everything!) tour in Austria followed in the fall.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: The highlight of this tour was the concert at Vienna city hall in November, which sold out all 11,000 tickets in a very short time.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: The concert was filmed, and along with some interviews and a short biography, was released in DVD form as Wirklich alles!
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: During the club tour that  began directly after the Vienna concert, she presented for the first time her own original compositions, which she had written with her band.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Beginning her career in Austria ===

sentences: At this time, Christina and her managers, Andreas Streit and Bernd Rengleshausen, were working towards breaking through in Germany.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: The single Vorbei was released in Germany in November 2004, but it fell short of expectations.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: In April 2005 a re-worked version of "Ich Lebe" was released in Germany.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: This single met with great  success; it rose to ninth place on the German charts, and shortly thereafter reached number four.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: The album which followed, named Schwarz Weiss (Black White) was released in June 2005, in Germany and Switzerland, reached number three on the German album charts, and stayed in the top twenty for more than a year.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: The majority of the songs on this album, which were mostly already known in Austria, were reproduced and oriented towards the emerging trends in German rock and pop music.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: The singles were "Engel fliegen Einsam" (Angels Fly Lonely)
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: "Mama (Ana Ahabak)", and "Immer an euch geglaubt" (Always Believed In You).
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: The singles were also re-recorded to be more rock oriented.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: In late 2005 Christina and her band toured through Germany and Switzerland.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: The Schwarz-Weiss tour, with just under 40 concerts, lasted two months, in which some concerts had to be relocated to larger halls because of the great demand for tickets.
section: == Early life and music career == | === Breakthrough in Germany ===

sentences: Christina Stürmer and her band had established themselves as a major group.
